channel.title: Illegal immigration
channel.description: I don't like the idea of people comming in and saying they have legal rights when they have not earned them . . . I'm really not good at opening debate subject but rather responding to them.

item.title: Illegal immigration
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The labour market gets flooded by these illegal immigrants. Because of that, the ‘prices’ for labour drops. If they transfer their money to their family in their homeland, the amount of money in a country drops. That ruins the economy if it’s done on a large scale.

Also, when the salaries drop, this does not only affect the sallary of a Mexican, but also the sallary of an American (someone from the US). Lower sallaries can create an economic recession, because if the sallaries drop, the consumers buy less. Then the companies have less to invest. I had a drawing of this, but I’m too lazy to scan it right now. But if the companies have less to invest, they usually borrow money. But the consumers earned less money, so they had less money to put on their bank acounts. So the offer of money on the bank market is lower. Thus making the interest higher. If the interest is high, the companies can borrow less money. And then they can’t invest that much. This means that some companies go bankrupt, causing more problems on the labour market. The only thing a government can do about this, is to invest more in government projects, such as schools and roads. (if they get payed by the government in the US, I’m not sure of that.) But I’ve heard that the US has a big debt so they can’t borrow too much money either.

So yea, that was my two cents on this

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal immigration
item.dc:creator: @animefreak animefreak
item.description:
@animefreak wrote:

Well consider this,

When my aunt came to this country with an 8 week old baby to get a better lifer for her daughter, she tried to come legally but the mexican/ us government was extremely busy and would get back to her in 9-12 years, so she came illegally. She lived a good life and was able to get…“married” again and live in a nice house. now, is it fair that her child whom just turned 18…may have to be deported any day now. in one eye i see that is unfair, they are ignored unless they try to become citizens. in another eye, i see a family of gangbangers with full citizenship… Its not the people coming, its the people in charge. If we want to Rid the mexicans, combine the country and grant amnesty to all citizens, it will ruin the economy but…we can manage, for a brighter future.
